attributes.action: Hold a confirmatory referendum to give clarity to the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has voted to leave the EU, but it does not know what it wants or how its elected government is to put its wishes into effect.
Proposed second referendum to ask:
Are you sure?
To which answer,
Yes, leave EU at any cost,
No, remain in EU and seek changes to EU constitution
attributes.additional_details:
The UK electorate has now had the opportunity to examine the consequences of the referendum but it has had no voice in saying how the country will pursue its future foreign policy and its trading relationships.
There is anecdotal evidence that the vote was used as a protest against the current political establishment.
A second referendum, if positive, will provide political legitimacy to the current government.

attributes.action: Present a draft UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria.
attributes.background: UK to call on all civilised nations of the world (via the United Nations) to draft a UN resolution that would implement a no fly zone over Syria and would apply to ALL aircraft of Syria, Russia, and lran for the purposes of military operations until the complete and total cessation of hostilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3000,000 people have now lost their lives in this conflict. The UN has officially declared Aleppo as besieged. Russian and Syrian forces and their allies must not be allowed to continue to flout international law and bomb civilians, civilian infrastructure, hospitals and aid operations. Since the breakdown of the recent cease-fire on September 19 over 500 civilians have been killed in Aleppo alone, with at least 100 of those being children.
Sources: 
www.unicef.org
www.syriahr.com
and more

attributes.action: Outlaw sale of electronics with firmware reflashing code that can be reflashed
attributes.background: For security, require electronic devices with "reflashable" or other alterable firmware to have the section of code that performs the reflashing, and one that correctly downloads the current reflashable firmware contents, stored in Read Only Memory that is electronically impossible to alter.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyber attacks against hardware have begun to take the form of reflashing attacks which modify the firmware of the targeted device.

If the device's capability to be reflashed can itself be removed or tampered with by reflashing, attack code can make itself undetectable and impossible to remove, requiring the entire electronic device to be thrown away.

The proposal would obstruct this form of attack as fixed unchangable code would exist allow reflashing and reporting of flash memory contents.

attributes.action: 80 characters is not enough to express a political request. Extend limit to >999
attributes.background: I want to write a petition to the government not a twitter comment and I want people to understand from the outset what I want and why. Limiting the number of charterers I can write is extremely restrictive to allowing voters to express themselves.

attributes.action: Stop live music venues being closed by house buyers who chose to live there.
attributes.background: Fewer venues are open for musicians to play in because of home owners who complain AFTER buying.  The venue is then closed. Buyers should sign an acknowledgment of the venue as part of the buying process.
attributes.additional_details: Musicians have few places left to play.  This will be to the detriment of our potentially rich live music future and will effect tourism and local culture.  When all music venues are gone, the same people who complained about noise will bemoan it's loss.

attributes.action: Make the supplier of broadband supply the speed you should get and pay for
attributes.background: I should get 200 meg but only get 57 meg like most people on the supplier forum

attributes.action: The general election must be made a public holiday.
attributes.background: This will help increase voter turnout.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the press to use entrapment to produce 'sensational' stories
attributes.background:
It is too easy for journalists to entrap an unsuspecting victim into revealing information that they wouldn't volunteer if they knew that they were talking to the press.
This can cause people to lose their jobs or cause humiliation
It is deceitful and fraudulent. But is it in the public interest.
attributes.additional_details:
Sex Scandals, Politicians, Celebrities. The only reason they do it is to increase their market share, yet claim it is in the public interest.
This could ruin an aspiring politician, business person or celebrity for a good scoop.
Most recent case is Sam Alerdice, the former England Manager, who revealed some embarrassing 'trade secrets' to what he thought were businessmen, but were gutter press.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of live Animals in all UK Pet Shops
attributes.background:
It's currently too easy for the general public to impulse buy pets many of which end up being sold, rehomed, surrendered to rescues 
The staff in the pet shops generally do not have the right skills or training for each animal.
All too often profit comes before welfare with many pet shops.
attributes.additional_details:
Many visits to a local (branded) pet shop, none of the staff show any trained skills of being able to deal with each animal 
not knowing how to handle a Budgie or get it out of the cage, 

Sending a Chicken back to the supplier for making "funny nosies" this chicken was going to be sent back to be put down, hanging air freshers in the cages of Rabbits and Chickens.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who experience emission problems with their diesel vehicles
attributes.background: Since 2009 diesel vehicles have been fitted with a diesel particulate filter (DPFs) to remove particles of soot etc from the exhaust to protect the environment and the air we breathe. These filters are failing or becoming clogged up and consumers are being presented with costly repair bills.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally was advised that to repair my Honda Civic which was under 4 years old and had covered 33000 miles the cost would be over £3600. Almost 20% of its cost new. Correspondence with Honda UK proved unsuccessful. Some manufacturers do not include DPF's in their warranties. 

I would like to see Manufacturers being forced to give 
1) A retrospective guarantee on DPF's for a period of 10 years or 150,000 miles
2) To recall all vehicles sold since 2009 and test the DPFs, compensating owners

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Have urban areas hold an independence referendum on their membership in the UK
attributes.background: The social and cultural attitudes of those living in urban areas are drastically different to those of rural communities. Due to this cultural divide, having urban areas declare independence to form a Federal Urban Republic of Britain will ensure that the will of the urban population is carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
After declaring independence, we will be left with extreme border gore around the entire country. As the Federal Urban Republic of Britain, we must first form devolved parliaments, and a central parliament most likely in London. We must then negotiate our relationship with the rural areas we left behind, possibly negotiating a free movement of people agreement. It is likely that the FURB will want to stay in the EU, and so a referendum must take place to decide this.
We shall be called FURBies.

attributes.action: Stop payroll co.'s charging admin fees to agency workers for processing earnings
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies use payroll companies to process agency worker earnings. The worker is commonly charged up to £20 per week simply to receive their pay! This equates to around £1,000 per year often taken from low paid workers.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !

attributes.action: Close or take drastic measures to improve the 111 nhs service.
attributes.background: The NHS 111 service continually provide incorrect information and put people's lives at risk and put extra strain on the hospitals, doctors and the ambulance service. They also don't listen to what the problem is , they read a computer screen.

attributes.action: Require by law Landlords/Ladies to change mattresses between different tenants.
attributes.background: Hi. I'm just another student in the London renting market. Yep, that open sewer of real estate. Thanks to not being provided a new mattress when I moved in to a property, I have had both fleas and bedbugs. I am asking that the government require new mattresses for new tenants.
attributes.additional_details:
When I moved into a property two years ago my mattress had been left in the shed for a "few" days whilst work was done on my room. Instead of receiving a new mattress I got the old one from the previous tenant, plus some new friends - fleas! 
This year, I moved into a property and discovered the old mattress was infested with bed bugs! Thanks previous tenant! 
Whilst it may be expensive to replace mattresses, no tenant should have to live through bug infestations.

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: Stop the sale of kittens and puppies in pet shops
attributes.background: It is devastating to see that there are so many stray dogs and cats on the streets these days. Many are due to the fact that people go to pet stores, see an adorable little baby kitten or puppy and buy it on whim then further on down the line become bored and they end up in shelters up for adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent this drastically if pet shops stop selling puppies and kittens. It will force people to go to the shelter and adopt an animal from there or make them think about it instead of buying them on impulse. Some pet shops won't vet the home it is going to, to make sure it's going to the best home possible.
We ask for urgent action to raise awareness & encourage the public to choose a responsibly bred puppy/kitten with history information, or adopt from a legitimate rescue organisation.

attributes.action: Completely change the old system of education we have today.
attributes.background: Uk needs a modern integral education based on the talents and abilities of students; so that when they finish secondary they know three languages and have a defined job. Children 0-6 years will learn playing, 7-11 years will learn practicing at school, 12-16 years will learn practicing in companies.
attributes.additional_details: The education be taught with computers and practices they will be guided by specialized teachers in each area; so that at years a child will be in the ability to program a computer and at 12 years he will have a profession. With the new system of education in the 21st century; let's educate for entrepreneurs to be those that produce jobs and not like the old traditional education, which teaches to create simple employees. We are going to take advantage of the new technologies and scientific advances to integrally educated and with high quality our children, who are the future of the Nation.

attributes.action: Build a minimum of 100,000 social/council houses per year
attributes.background: With immigration at over 300,000 per year for the last 15 years we do not have enough housing. Private landlords are taking over £9bn a year in housing benefit. This money should be spent on building social housing where low income persons can feel secure in a long term tenancy.
attributes.additional_details: The surge in HMO's - House of Multiple Occupancy and extortionate private rents is forcing people to live in poor conditions. Social housing with long term tenancies will help to create a better community where people can call their house a home. Private letting creates a transient community of people leaving and moving every few months and destabilises peoples lives for work, health care and general community cohesion.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to see if UK citizens wish to keep all their current rights.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, request that a Referendum be held to see if there is public support for the adoption of new legislation, of whatever kind, by Parliament or other executive means, that will result in the loss or modification of any rights currently held by every UK citizen.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the form of the Referendum should be two questions as follows:

YES. I agree to the adoption by Parliament of new legislation that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK Citizen.

NO. I do not agree to the adoption of new legislation by Parliament that will result in the loss or modification of rights that I currently hold as a UK citizen.

Currently, Parliament seems set on invoking legislation that will result in the loss of rights by all.

attributes.action: England, Wales and Northern Ireland to hold a referendum on Scotland leaving UK
attributes.background: For the past 300 years England has been held responsible for all the failures that has beset Scotland. A referendum was held and the people of Scotland decided to remain in the UK. I believe the concessions given to the people was unreasonable and very expensive for the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe it has now become unfair that the rest of the UK is continually being asked to fit the bill in Scotland. 
It must be remembered that Scotland has free University education, free nursing home care for the elderly.
I do accept these are it would be good for all the UK to have these however, others accept these are affordable because of the subsidies Scotland receives. The latest request for half a billion pounds is the latest demand.

attributes.action: take alcohol off display in shops like cigarettes and no advertising
attributes.background:
Alcohol-related crime in the UK is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
A fifth (29%) of all violent incidents in 2013–14 took place in or around a pub or club. ...
attributes.additional_details: There were 8,270 casualties of drink driving accidents in the UK in 2013, including 240 fatalities and 1,100 people who suffered serious injury.

attributes.action: Amend The Equality Act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.background:
Many companies in the UK are starting to use "anti-smoking policies" that they will not hire, and even terminate an employees contract for smoking, even if they smoke off the employers premises. 
I feel as if the government should update the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle choices.
attributes.additional_details:
Over in the USA, 30 States have made  similar legislations to protect workers personal life. 
If we amend the equality act 2010 to include lifestyle/personal life's of workers, this will include a lot of lifestyle choices, Anything from smoking to being vegan. It's ridiculous that some companies won't employ smokers. Why should a business go out of its way to not employ someone who smokes which is a personal choice, even if the employee agrees to smoke off premises?.

attributes.action: Ensure fair pricing for those with worse eyesight.
attributes.background: Glass lens thickness is based on prescription strength. People with poor eyesight are limited, and must suffer (physically) from wearing heavier lenses. Vendors in the UK sell thinner lenses for a substantial premium (over £100). This pricing should be voided so glasses costs are fair for all.

attributes.action: The import and personal use of DMT-containing plant materials should be legal.
attributes.background: While the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016 is right to ban some dangerous legal highs, a blanket ban is ill-considered. Personal use and import of DMT-containing plant materials, in their natural form, should be legal, especially since the possession of said item is NOT a crime under this new act.
attributes.additional_details:
Certain plants and plant materials found in nature have long been used for curing depression, learning about consciousness and developing spirituality for those who find religion ineffective. Plants used for 'Ayahuasca' have powerful healing properties and have been used by many to help overcome depression, anxiety and stress. Personal use can allow people to study spirituality, the nature of our existence and consciousness as a right of their freedom.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayahuasca

attributes.action: Make it law that all members of Parliament take regular drug and alcohol tests.
attributes.background: The government are accountable to the people and as most companies now test for drugs and alcohol so should Parliament as they shouldn't be running as ministers if under the influence

attributes.action: Return Tier 1 Skilled Migrant visa for professionals of shortage occupation list
attributes.background: Currently there is a shortage occupation list which is well documented. Regardless of this shortage occupation list, the complex process for Tier 2 visa is a deterrent for companies to recruit even the perfect professional candidate from outside of the EU. UK thus loses the best to other EU nations!
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/486107/Shortage_Occupation_List_-_November_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Ban the Prime Minister and Cabinet from receiving cash in exchange for meetings
attributes.background: Prime Minister Theresa May is selling lunch meetings with herself at her 2016 party conference for £3,150.
attributes.additional_details:
See reports in the Guardian https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/02/theresa-may-3150-lunch-democracy-for-sale-lobbyists?CMP=fb_gu 

and the
Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/01/business-leaders-charged-3000-a-head-to-have-lunch-with-theresa/

attributes.action: Remove from doctors working within the NHS the right to strike.
attributes.background: I am a patient with two incurable deteriorating brain conditions. I have waited for six months for three appointments all of which are likely to be cancelled. I have followed the negotiations  closely and have very reluctantly come to the conclusion that the BMA  are being highly irresponsible.
attributes.additional_details:
Three reasons:
1) In May of this year the BMA representative described the new contract as a deal "All sides can sign up to" and that "Doctors can be confident in this new contract". They now say the contract is so bad there have to be massive damaging strikes.
2)There has been a large drop in support for the BMA's militant stance. Of the 54,000 members only a minority 21540 voted to reject the new contract. This is down from 98% at the start of the dispute. A responsible union would re-ballot its members.
3) The BMA have consistently refused to take action such as legal action which would not damage patients and would win their dispute.

attributes.action: Allow workers to continue to sacrifice their salaries in exchange for safer cars
attributes.background: The Daily Mail have reported today that "The Treasury’s proposed rules could come into force next April and would effectively kill off tax benefits worth thousands of pounds a year for company car drivers. Under the plans, workers would be taxed . . ."
attributes.additional_details: Salary sacrifice schemes are the only way some people would ever be able to drive a nice car - you see far fewer "old bangers" on the road nowadays. These schemes must be hugely beneficial to car manufacturers and all associated industries.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to issue a medal to the wounded military serving personnel.
attributes.background: Unlike the United States who issue the Purple Heart Medal, the British Armed Services do not recognize the sacrifices made by those who serve and are wounded or killed during their service by way of a special medal. We believe it is shameful that such a medal does not exist and needs to be rectified
attributes.additional_details: We ask the British Government to create a special medal to be awarded to servicemen and servicewomen who, while serving under competent authority in any capacity with one of the UK Armed Forces has been wounded or killed. We also ask that the Government consider that this medal be posthumously awarded to qualifying servicemen and servicewomen who have been wounded or killed since the 28th July 1914.

attributes.action: Create an Autumn Bank Holiday in November
attributes.background: The gap between the Late Summer Bank Holiday and Christmas Day is almost four months. An Autumn Bank Holiday would provide a welcome break between the two. Perhaps it could be based around Armistice Day, November 11.

attributes.action: Ban junk food and fizzy drinks companies from advertising
attributes.background:
There is no arguing that marketing companies make an impact. Food and drinks companies have some of the best marketing in the world. 

If we can eliminate advertising of fizzy drinks and junk food, we can work to really reduce the obesity epidemic which the western world is in the grip of.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a time where Santa's suit was Green, Red or Tan depending on the person drawing it, then Coca Cola came along and used Santa as part of their Christmas marketing drive and since then we've all come to know the jolly fat man in the red suit.

Advertising is extremely powerful and has a huge influence on the purchasing decisions of our nation. A ban on these companies would very likely decrease the sales of unhealthy goods in this country and help to decrease the obesity epidemic.

attributes.action: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining second degree
attributes.background: Student Finance Company England should provide loans for obtaining a second degree. Wales and Scotland provide finance for students wanting to obtain a second degree, as England does not it deters individuals from furthering their education and pursuing their dreams.
attributes.additional_details: Funding should not be an issue and stand in the way of education as some households cannot support the financial implications of obtaining higher education.

attributes.action: Stop NHS denying help for eating disorders on grounds patients are "too complex"
attributes.background: As someone who personally suffers from an eating disorder, I have been lucky to receive adequate treatment to recover. However, for a number of people who suffer and want to recover, particularly those who need admitting as an inpatient, some are told they are "too complex" for treatment.
attributes.additional_details: Due to lack of mental health beds, and NICE guidelines stipulating special requirements for the treatment of eating disorders, some patients are being told they are "too complex" to receive treatment at the present time, even though they are willing to recover in an inpatient setting. Due to the guidelines and shortage of beds, those with eating disorders are slipping through the cracks of the system, and this is allowing for needless deaths that could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Remove the charge for calling 101 non police emergency.
attributes.background: We shouldn't be charged 15 pence for calling 101, when calling 999 is free.

attributes.action: Introduction of Mental Health into National Curriculum and Hospitals
attributes.background:
We truly believe that more needs to be done in relation to suicide.

There should be no stigma attached to Mental Health and the only way to eradicate a stigma surrounding a 'taboo' subject is to educate by bringing it into National Curriculum and more information/care available in hospitals.
attributes.additional_details:
6581 committed suicide in 2014 alone, each and everyone of those people had a family, friends and countless people that would have been touched by their passing.
We passionately believe that the rates of suicide would decrease if Mental Health was part of the National Curriculum and the younger generation were aware of what symptoms to look out for in themselves and those around them
With that we also believe that there's room for improvement with information and Mental Health care in hospitals

attributes.action: Make ALL schools teach kids the dangers of the railway.
attributes.background:
We all know that the railway is a dangerous place, however people still do not understand this and are running across the tracks at stations, laying on the tracks or even playing chicken at level crossings.

Last year 332 people died after trespassing onto the railway tracks in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Now kids think it's right to play on the railway and ignore all the safety rules displayed around the tracks. 

If schools teach kids that it's dangerous to play on or around the railway then the figures might go down and there will be less deaths.

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: Add safeguards to §111A (Enterprise & Regulatory Reform Act 2013) for employees.
attributes.background:
The current laws regarding 'Settlement Agreements' or 'Without Prejudice Conversations' or 'Protected Conversations' or 'Off the record Conversations' are shockingly lacking in safeguards for the employee.

They can be sprung upon an employee as a way of getting rid of them without red tape.
attributes.additional_details:
They are being used currently by employers as a way to place 'no other options decisions' on the employee and there is not enough safeguarding process to resolve relationship issues through other steps first. Much like you can't go to tribunal without a certificate from ACAS, employers should not be allowed to have these types of conversation without all possible other avenues exhausted first.

I'm not suggesting that the option shouldn't be there, it should just be limited to the final ones.

attributes.action: Represent Wales in the Union Jack incorporating Y Ddraig Goch (The Welsh Dragon)
attributes.background:
When the Union Jack was introduced in 1606 its design did and still does today represent the four nations which make up the United Kingdom. 

However, it is only made up of three of the constituent countries' flags and we believe, in the spirit of the unity it represents - that should change.
attributes.additional_details:
Agnieszka, S. (2013) The Union Flag and Flags of the United Kingdom. Section Parliament and Constitution Centre, UK.

Cleans, G. (2007) Union Jack should include Welsh Flag, says MP. The Daily Telegraph, UK. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/politics/1570613/Union-Jack-should-include-Welsh-flag-says-MP.html

Contributors: Jacob William Billingsley, James Stacey Mayes, Patrick John Alderson, Ruari Iain Macneil

attributes.action: Introduce motorcycle licence progression training as per the 3rd EU Directive.
attributes.background: Department of Transport ignored the licence progression training in Article 7.1.c of 3rd EU Driving Licence Directive. It imposed compulsory retesting which removed all incentive for novices to train and qualify for A1. There was an 8% increase in Killed & Seriously Injured 'after' implementation.
attributes.additional_details: 17-19 year olds can ride A1 class bikes (125cc) on a CBT cert. At 19 they can take the A2 test for larger bikes. There is now no incentive to train to A1 test standard because they are forced to repeat the same tests when they are entitled to progress at 19. This essentially entices them to wait and continue on a CBT. They ride for up to 2 years without any highway code knowledge, theory test and hazard perception. CBT only gives them 2 hours road preparation. DVSA stats show a 8% KSI increase.

attributes.action: Stop BBC Threats to Spy on all WiFi Connections, make iplayer Password Protected
attributes.background:
On 01/09/16 paying TV licence free is required to watch iplayer.

To enforce this BBC claim they've developed new WiFi snooping detector vans, to packet sniff all WiFi connections to see if iplayer is being used.

This is a gross invasion of privacy.  Not wanting to watch the BBC is not a crime!
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC already have access to the information of who is watching iplayer.  When someone watches their IP address is logged on the BBC server, which uniquely identifies which internet connection has been using it. 

The BBC have the option to make the iplayer password protected, much like Netflix or Amazon Prime.  This password could be associated with a TV licence, so only licence payers can use the service.

Detection vans are an unnecessary invasion of privacy & waste of licence payers money.

attributes.action: Force Manufacturers of all goods to make warranties transferable.
attributes.background: I wanted to buy a lens that's only 4 months old. The maker told me that the 12 month warranty isn't transferable and applies to the original purchaser only.  Common with consumer goods. I think they should simply have to guarantee the product for a period of time regardless of changes in ownership.

attributes.action: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.
attributes.background: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.
attributes.additional_details: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths.

attributes.action: We the 17.5 million Brexit Supporters demand a general election immediately
attributes.background: Teresa May is stalling the process, meeting with Brussels, Angela Merkel and The First Minister of Scotland, and Is also allowing unelected peers to try and block Brexit, she is not honouring her pledge that Brexit means Brexit, she was not elected by the people of the UK

attributes.action: Government to fund a program to help local councils to house the homeless.
attributes.background: When you walk through any city, today you will see numerous homeless people, many of us have probably looked down at them as wasters but if you stop, sit and talk to them you will realise that misguided. The time for action is now, Government needs to give the councils the money to help the homeless
attributes.additional_details: They are from all walks of life but have one thing in common down on luck. I have started siting down and talking to some who I see reguarly over the last year or so. From the ex-soldier with no where to go, to the college student who had quit her course when she became homeless. All tell the same story, living on sofas, looking for a job, 1 night on the street turns into 2 which before long is 367.
